Name.label: Postaxial polydactyly-anterior pituitary anomalies-facial dysmorphism syndrome
Syndrome with limb duplication, polydactyly, syndactyly, and/or hyperphalangy
Disease associated with non-acquired combined pituitary hormone deficiency

TextSection.Contents: Postaxial polydactyly-anterior pituitary anomalies-facial dysmorphism syndrome is a rare, genetic developmental defect during embryogenesis disorder characterized primarily by congenital hypopituitarism and/or postaxial polydactyly. It can be associated with short stature, delayed bone age, hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, and/or midline facial defects (e.g. hypotelorism, mild midface hypoplasia, flat nasal bridge, and cleft lip and/or palate). Hypoplastic anterior pituitary and ectopic posterior pituitary lobe are frequent findings on MRI examination.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
